meanings.definition: To ski or race in a zigzag course between obstacles or flags.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed slaloming down the mountain, weaving between the trees.
meanings.sent2: During the competition, the skier was slaloming expertly around the poles.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried slaloming between the icebergs but kept bumping into them.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were slaloming back and forth, unable to focus on one thing.
meanings.sent5: The river slaloming through the valley created a beautiful natural pattern.

meanings.definition: To move or twist in a winding path while skiing or snowboarding.
meanings.sent1: He was slaloming gracefully down the slope, enjoying the fresh snow.
meanings.sent2: The kids were slaloming playfully on their snowboards, laughing all the way.
meanings.sent3: The cat was slaloming around the furniture, chasing after a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were slaloming through different possibilities, trying to find a solution.
meanings.sent5: The snake was slaloming through the grass, moving with incredible agility.
